titleStmt.title: William R. Jones to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6591

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: to his Exlency Thos E bramlet Gov of the state of Kentucky your petietioner Thos. Tuttle states that at March Term of the Laurel circuit court, that, he was find $20. for giveing one E s. Grigory a dram & Remarked at, the time that, Grigory owed him Ten cts, for said dram which was passed in a Joke for which he was in dited & find as a bove stated Tuttle is a young man Keeps no drinking shops he states that he Just had a botle in his pocket, & give a friend a dram & Remarked that he owed him 10 cts he states that he was not at the Trial & N New nothing a bout the Judgement of the court untill & Execution was, Issued, he states that he never Received one cents for the dram nor never thought of such a thing, & he prays that you extend the hand of mercy & Remit said find he is poore & with out Father & m Mother, & is a loan in the world, & is sober & hard working, & that a bell to pay said find,, & ther fore begs mercy at your hands, ^Thos. Tuttle^ swore to before me the by Thos. Tuttle that the a bove facts is True Bushes store Laurel co Ky this day & date a bove

Laurel Cir Ct
vs
Thos Tuttle
$20
